intro: Paepalanthus ibitipocensis, commonly known as the Ibitipocénsis pincushion cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its dense, spiny stems that resemble a pincushion. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
